meanings.definition: Not fully ripe; not yet ready to be eaten or used.
meanings.sent1: The underripe banana was still green and not sweet.
meanings.sent2: The farmer picked the underripe tomatoes to allow them to ripen on the windowsill.
meanings.sent3: The underripe peach tried to act mature, but it was still too firm to be taken seriously.
meanings.sent4: Her underripe talent needed time to develop before it could shine brightly.
meanings.sent5: The underripe apple lacked the juicy sweetness of its fully ripe counterparts.

meanings.definition: Immature in development; not yet fully grown or developed.
meanings.sent1: The underripe puppy was still small and learning how to walk properly.
meanings.sent2: The underripe ideas needed more time to mature into a well-thought-out plan.
meanings.sent3: His underripe sense of humor often led to awkward situations.
meanings.sent4: The underripe friendship needed nurturing to grow into a strong bond.
meanings.sent5: The underripe plant struggled to reach its full potential without proper care and attention.
